content:
Hello!
I feel super dumb right now, I see there is a audit.toml.example shipped in the cargo-audit repository. I tried to use it but I cannot seem to find the suitable cli option to specify the config file.
I have tried:

$ cargo audit --config audit.toml
error: unrecognized option `--config`

cargo-audit 0.13.1
Tony Arcieri <bascule@gmail.com>
Audit Cargo.lock for crates with security vulnerabilities

FLAGS:
    -c, --config CONFIG       path to configuration file
    -h, --help                print help message
    -v, --verbose             be verbose

It's really surprising because this help message suggest the usage of -c but actually -c is unrelated flag color and --config does not work as shown.
My use case is that there are some advisories that I want to ignore and I don't want to specify all of them on the cli, I would rather use the config file
@marmeladema if you place it in .cargo/audit.toml it should pick it up automatically
Oh ok thanks! I'll try that tomorrow!
Is this documented somewhere and I missed it?
not sure if the docs have been appropriately updated
Is there anything I can do to help? Where would be the place to document this feature? The README?
